intro: Microloma calycinum var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered microloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy texture. It produces small, rounded fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed in horticulture.
